author: ralexstokes
content:
just published my initial work on a separate implementation of the `mev-boost` software to help out w/ Merge testing

https://github.com/ralexstokes/mev-boost-rs

expect things to be a little chaotic with the repo until we solidify the builder specs but if anyone is interested to help out w/ implementation let me know üôÇ

EL JSON for now, will push CL style soon

author: tersec
content: yeah, I can't tell that either. The process has begun, but that's part of what I'm asking about interop test plans -- from a Nimbus perspective (and different CLs definitely differ here -- some are more modular in this regard), the EL-based JSON approach is just implemented differently enough from the CL-based one that if the latter [which I do think is better, per discussion previously] is a fait accompli, well, it doesn't make much sense to try to get a working/testable branch for the EL version.

author: metachris_
content:
Re testing:
- for local testing, I'll implement the REST API spec into mergemock and mev-boost the coming days (should be ready middle of next week)
- we'll get a proper builder and relay up and running for kiln the coming week, where clients can connect to and test with real payloads

author: metachris_

author: lightclient
content: hmm probably because i set the remote to be an ssh address

author: ralexstokes
content: i had the same issue, make sure your ssh key on github is registered w/ your local ssh agent

author: ralexstokes
content:
and re: specs, my understanding is that we are moving to this combo:

 https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/209 and https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/pull/2

now would be the time to review those PRs and chime in w/ any feedback, the sooner they get merged the sooner the rest of the testing infra can be developed

author: ralexstokes
content: so i implemented most of what is in `builder-specs#2` here https://github.com/ralexstokes/mev-boost-rs/pull/1 and found it is not quite complete yet but VERY close

author: metachris_
